intro: Raphanus brassica, commonly known as the wild radish, is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its erect, branching stem and pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which are followed by round, swollen fruits known as siliques. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia and is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. The plant has a taproot that is typically white or pale yellow in color.
